title: Antonio Conte planning to sign Jose Mourinho favourite from Man Utd
text:
Nemanja Matic has started just two Premier League games for Man Utd this season (Picture: Getty)

Inter Milan are planning to raid Manchester United yet again in January with Nemanja Matic high on Antonio Conte’s list of priorities.

The former Chelsea manager has made a promising start to his tenure at the San Siro, with Inter having won six of their opening seven Serie A matches.

Conte oversaw a huge overhaul of his first team squad in the summer, bolstering his attack with the additions of United misfits Romelu Lukaku and Alexis Sanchez.

The 50-year-old is now, according to The Sun, looking to reinforce his midfield options and wants to be reunited with Matic who is said to have decided he wants to quit Old Trafford when the transfer window reopens.

Conte was furious when Chelsea allowed Jose Mourinho to sign Matic in the summer of 2017 and believes the 31-year-old represents a value for money option.

Matic, who won the Premier League under both Conte and Mourinho, has started just two Premier League matches this season and appears to have been deemed surplus to requirements by Ole Gunnar Solskjaer.

‘I have been in football for a long time, I have played almost all the games for all the clubs in the last ten years,’ Matic said back in September after he had been left out of the opening three games of the season.

‘In order for me to play, one had to sit on the bench and accept that fact, and so do I now. In the first two or three games he picked the team without me.

‘I work as hard as I can. We respect the decision, it’s up to me to show him that he was wrong and to bring me back to where I belong.

‘There is no problem. I told him I disagreed with him but that he had to decide the team.’
